Entries.default: The inquisitor, flanked by reflections of herself, greets your entrance with a cold stare. Entropic spirit energy swirls about her.

"You've much to answer for, inquisitor, and I intend to see you suffer for it."

Cold hatred radiates from the shackled spirit as her eyes burn with crimson light.
"Inquisitor! You abandoned your sacred charge! You made a sacrifice of order on the altar of orthodoxy!" Her eyes flash gray like cold steel.
"Remember that you're not only the worst things you've done, but the best as well."
"You could try kissing."
"You've come to end me, then? To consign these lands to chaos?"
"Inquisitor! Look at what you've done in the name of order! At what you've become!" Blue essence streams from her eyes.
"The two of you can still reconcile. You're more alike than not."

"Inquisitor. I came here with the aim of ending you."

The elf stares at the palms of her hands, her eyes pulsing a muddled violet.

"I know it."

The masked woman nods slightly.
"Forgive each other."
"Accept each other."

"'Tis a certainty that I have lost. It fled me, I think - each memory restored providing it another egress."

The inquisitor again nods.
[Attack them both.] "So be it."
"I can't answer that for you."
"How? It seems impossible."
"You think this one your champion then?" The inquisitor gestures towards you.

"In that, at least, we are in accord."

Leather squeaks as the inquisitor's hands clench into tight little fists.
She nods and squeezes your forearm, a faint smile lighting her battered features.
"For you to be free, she has to die."
"Thank you. I'd very nearly forgotten myself."
"You think there's another way?"
"We came here to end this. Don't lose your way now."
"Let us bring an end to this."
"The intruder would destroy us both."
"'Tis true, and I've always known it. I've used him, as he'd use me."
Entries.female: "'Tis true, and I've always known it. I've used her, as she'd use me."

Entries.default:
"Shall we destroy him then, that we might conclude our own business?"

The spirit at your side nods.
Entries.female:
"Shall we destroy her then, that we might conclude our own business?"

The spirit at your side nods.

Entries.default: "I've a bad feeling 'bout this one, cap."
"She's consumed by her hatred. They both are."
"I only know that I feel... lessened somehow. Or, perhaps, more aware of what I lack."
"And all that in between."

"Were that it so easily accomplished."

She turns to Naxiva.
The Engwithans look to one another, then back to you.
"No. I think not."
The Engwithans look to one another, then back to you.
"Ye ettle at kissin', I could gie ye wysins."
"Might have a couple drinks in my pack that could move things along."
"That's your solution for everything, you old charmer." Maia winks at you.
"Is everyone in the Deadfire so obsessed with kissing? It is not a solution to every problem!"
"Kissing is always good. Except when it is bad. Even then, it could be worse."
"Yes, because that always solves everything."
"That could fix things. Or it could make them deliciously complicated. Either way, you have my attention."
"Well, I don't see how that's going to help."
"Then I suggest we do what we came to do."
"What say you, inquisitor? Is there aught to be salvaged between these two sad souls?"
Naxiva grimaces, her lips twitching at the corner as her focus shifts from you to the apparition at your side and back again.
"In resisting her you only resist yourself."
"Aren't you tired of struggling? Isn't it time to rest?"
"It's that or we destroy you."
[Say nothing.]

"I've certainly been responsible for worse decisions."

The apparition smiles, even as it begins to unravel at the edges.
With a quiet snort, she begins to chuckle.
"No, there's nothing I recognize in this creature."
The inquisitor's mask tilts towards the roof of the chamber as if she's looking to the gods for her answer.
"If you've come to make an attempt on my life, interloper, make it. And Woedica judge your soul."
As the inquisitor fades, the other entities in the hall screech as if in pain. They advance upon you.
As the last of the spirits succumb to your assault, the room falls deathly silent.
The ambient essence of inquisitor and accused alike swirl about you, a hot wind of anger and loathing, before being sucked away into the cold absence of the White Void.

Rekke quietly gasps.

When you flick your gaze to him, his face is turned away, his features obscured by a curtain of hair.

He takes shallow, shaking breaths.
